title: A Closer Look At Governor's Races In Kansas, Colorado, Connecticut
teaser: This year, almost a dozen incumbent governors are at risk of losing their bids for reelection. We take a look at three of those races.
contentencoded:
Next month we could see a historic gubernatorial election. Not since 1984 have more than six sitting governors lost in any one election, but this year, almost a dozen incumbents are in trouble.

Here & Now hosts Robin Young and Jeremy Hobson take a look at three of those states — Kansas, Colorado and Connecticut — with political reporters covering those races: Frank Morris of KCUR in Kansas City, Megan Verlee of Colorado Public Radio and John Dankosky of WNPR in Hartford, Conn.

Guests

  • Megan Verlee, reporter for Colorado Public Radio. She tweets @CPRverlee.
  • John Dankosky, news director and host of “Where We Live” at WNPR in Hartford, Conn. He tweets @johndankosky.
  • Frank Morris, national correspondent and senior editor for KCUR. He tweets @FrankNewsman.
